Student Affairs Office

Office Overview

The Dean of Students is concerned with students' welfare from entry to graduation. Our office has dedicated staff members whose responsibility is to help students settle down and adjust to college life, ensuring a supportive and conducive learning environment.

We believe that a student's academic success is deeply connected to their overall well-being. Therefore, our comprehensive approach addresses not only academic needs but also social, emotional, and physical aspects of student life at Kongoni Technical and Vocational College.

Our team works collaboratively to create an inclusive environment where every student can thrive. We address any social issues that can affect students' academic performance, providing timely intervention and support services to ensure student success.

Our Mission

To provide comprehensive student support services that promote academic excellence, personal development, and holistic growth, ensuring every student has the resources and guidance needed to succeed in their educational journey and beyond.

  • Facilitate smooth transition to college life
  • Provide comprehensive welfare services
  • Support academic and personal development
  • Foster a vibrant campus community

Student Welfare Services

Accommodation Services

Headed by: Senior Housekeeper

Coordination of room accommodation and maintenance of cleanliness in and around the hostels

Room allocation and coordination
Hostel cleanliness maintenance
Student accommodation support
Facility management and upkeep

Catering Services

Headed by: Senior Cateress

Provision of good quality meals in a clean environment under the Pay As You Eat system

Quality meal provision
Pay As You Eat system
Clean dining environment
Nutritious food programs

Medical Services

Headed by: Clinical Officer

Ensures that students get medical services in college and transfers complicated cases to nearby hospitals

On-campus medical care
Health consultations
Emergency response
Hospital referrals when needed

Games & Sports

Headed by: HOD Physical Education

Participation in games and sports under the Kenya Technical Institutions Sports Association

KTISA competitions
Inter-college tournaments
Sports facilities management
Athletic development programs

Financial Support & Bursaries

We provide various financial assistance programs to ensure that financial constraints do not hinder students from achieving their academic goals.

HELB Loans

Higher Education Loans Board financing for eligible students

College Bursaries

Institution-specific financial assistance programs

CDF Bursaries

Constituency Development Fund educational support

Clubs & Societies

Our vibrant student community offers numerous opportunities for personal growth, skill development, and meaningful engagement through various clubs and societies.

Spiritual growth and fellowship community

Seventh-day Adventist student organization focusing on faith and service

Innovation Clubs
